snippet: As a young community organizer in Chicago, Barack Obama concluded that to make a real difference, he needed to gain power. But did he make a difference? Paul Tough reports in The New York Times magazine.
abstract: As a young community organizer in Chicago, Barack Obama concluded that to make a real difference, he needed to gain power. But did he make a difference? Paul Tough reports in The New York Times magazine.

headline.main: From the Magazine: Roseland, Where Obama the Politician Was Born
